text.strong: ‌On what date were you born?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select the day, month, and year from the drop-down menus to answer the question.)‌

text.strong: ‌What <grade> are you in?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select from the drop-down menu to answer the question.)‌

text.strong: ‌How old were you when you started <ISCED 0>?‌

text.em: ‌(Please choose from the drop-down menu to answer the question.)‌

label.text: Years1 year or younger2 years3 years4 years5 years6 years or olderI did not attendI do not remember

text.strong: ‌How long have you been enrolled at this school?‌

label.text: Three or more school years, not including this school year
Two school years, not including this school year
One school year, not including this school year
I came to this school at the start of this school year.
I came to this school after the start of this school year.

text.strong: ‌Which one of the following <programmes> are you in?‌
‌Have you ever repeated a <grade>?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

text.strong: ‌What language do you speak at home most of the time?‌
‌How many languages in total do you speak with people at home?‌
‌In what country were you and your parents born?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each column.)‌

text.strong: ‌How old were you when you arrived in <country of test>?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select from the drop-down menu to answer the question. If you were less than 12 months old, please select “age 0-1” (age zero to one).)‌
‌Imagine a 10-point scale that represents how much effort you invest in something.‌
‌The highest value (10) marks a situation where you tried your very best and put as much effort as possible to do well.‌
‌The lowest value (1) marks a situation where you did not try hard at all and put the lowest possible effort to do well.‌

text.strong: ‌Now think about the effort you put into completing the PISA test and questionnaire.‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: How much effort did you put into doing well on the PISA test?
How much effort would you have invested if your results from the PISA test were going to be counted in your <school marks>?
Now think about the PISA questionnaire you just answered. How much effort did you put into giving accurate answers?

text.strong: ‌To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: I feel safe on my way to school.
I feel safe on my way home from school.
I feel safe in my classrooms at school.
I feel safe at other places at school (e.g. hallway, cafeteria, restroom).

text.strong: ‌During the past four weeks, did any of the following events occur?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: I witnessed a fight on school property in which someone got hurt.
I heard a student threaten to hurt another student.
I saw a student carrying a gun or knife at school.

text.strong: ‌Thinking about your school: to what extent do you agree with the following statements?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: I feel like an outsider (or left out of things) at school.
I make friends easily at school.
I feel like I belong at school.
I feel awkward and out of place in my school.
Other students seem to like me.

text.strong: ‌During the past 12 months, how often have you had the following experiences in school?‌

text.em: ‌(Some experiences can also happen in social media.)‌
‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: Other students left me out of things on purpose.
Other students made fun of me.
I was threatened by other students.
Other students took away or destroyed things that belonged to me.
I got hit or pushed around by other students.
Other students spread nasty rumours about me.
Information about me was published online without my consent.

text.strong: ‌To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: The teachers at my school are respectful towards me.
If I walked into my classes upset, my teachers would be concerned about me.
If I came back to visit my school three years from now, my teachers would be excited to see me.
I feel intimidated by the teachers at my school.
When my teachers ask how I am doing, they are really interested in my answer.
The teachers at my school are friendly to me.
The teachers at my school are interested in students' well-being.
The teachers at my school are mean to me.

text.strong: ‌In the last two full weeks of school, how often did the following things occur?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

text.strong: ‌This school year, about how many hours a day do you usually use <digital resources> in the following situations?‌

text.em: ‌(Please think of different kinds of <digital resources> such as desktop computers, laptops and tablets as well as educational software and other digital learning tools.)‌
‌(Please select one response from the drop-down menus to answer the questions.)‌

label.text: For learning activities before and after school
For leisure before and after school

text.strong: ‌Think about your use of <digital devices>. How often do you feel or act the following ways?‌

text.em: ‌If you don’t have or use a <digital device>, please select “not applicable”.‌
‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌
‌All or almost all of the time‌

label.text: I turn off notifications from social networks and apps on my <digital devices> during class.
I turn off notifications from social networks and apps on my <digital devices> when I go to sleep.
I keep my <digital device> near me to answer messages when I am home.
I have my <digital device> open in class so I can take notes or search for information.
I feel pressured to be online and answer messages when I am in class.
I feel nervous/anxious when I don’t have my <digital device> near me.

text.strong: ‌How often do your parents or someone in your family do the following things with you?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: Discuss how well you are doing at school.
Spend time just talking with you.
Talk to you about the importance of <completing ISCED 3>
Talk to you about any problems you might have at school.
Ask you about how well you are getting along with other students at school.
Take an interest in what you are learning at school.
Talk to you about your future education.
Ask you what you did in school that day.
Talk to you about everyday science-related topics.

text.strong: ‌Which of the following <school science> courses did you attend this school year or last school year?‌

label.text: Specialized Science (e.g., <Forensic science, Medical Science, Marine biology>
Applied sciences and technology (e. g. <country-specific example>)
<General, integrated, or comprehensive science> course (e. g. <country-specific example>)

text.strong: ‌Environmental issues are varied and include climate change, loss of biodiversity, water, and food shortages, pollution, and waste management.‌
‌How much do you agree with the following statements about environmental issues?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: I believe that humans are taking important steps to fix environmental issues
Scientists have solutions to fix environment issues
I am making changes in my behaviour (e.g., walking rather than driving in a car) that will help solve environmental issues
I know that there are things that I can do to help solve environmental issues
If people work together, we can solve environmental issues
Even though I take action to help solve environmental issues, they are too much for me alone to fix
The environmental issues caused by humans are too big and complex to be fixed

text.strong: ‌The following question asks about your experience in learning <school science> topics.‌
‌How much do you agree with the statements below?‌

text.em: ‌(Please tick only one box in each row)‌

label.text: Learning advanced school science topics would be easy for me

text.p: I can usually give good answers to test questions on school science topics

label.text: I learn school science topics quickly
School science topics are easy for me
When I am being taught school science, I can understand the concepts very well

text.p: I can easily understand new ideas in school science

label.text: I get higher grades in School Science than my peers do
I consistently get good grades in School Science
I get higher grades in School Science than I do in other subjects

text.strong: ‌How much do you disagree or agree with the statements about yourself below?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: I generally have fun when I am learning <broad science> topics.
I am happy working on <broad science> topics.
I enjoy acquiring new knowledge in <broad science>.
I am interested in learning about <broad science>.

text.strong: ‌Which of the following qualifications do you expect to complete?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

text.strong: ‌To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statements?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: I worry that I am not prepared for life after <the final year of compulsory education>.
I feel well-informed about possible paths for me after <the final year of compulsory education>.
I feel pressure from my family to follow a specific path (e.g. go to college, work in the family business, learn a trade) after <the final year of compulsory education>.
I worry that I won't have enough money to do what I'd like to do after <the final year of compulsory education>.
School has done little to prepare me for adult life when I leave school.
School has been a waste of time.
School has helped give me confidence to make decisions.
School has taught me things which could be useful in a job.
I feel well-prepared for my future path after <the final year of compulsory education>.

text.strong: ‌Which of the following skills have you acquired?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: How to find information on jobs I am interested in.
How to search for a job.
How to write a <resume> or a summary of my qualifications and/or experience.
How to prepare for a job interview.
How to find information on student financing (e.g. student loans or grants).

text.strong: ‌Have you done any of the following to find out about future study or types of work?‌

text.em: ‌(Please select one response in each row.)‌

label.text: I attended <job shadowing or work-site visits>.
I spoke to a <career advisor> at my school.
I spoke to a <career advisor> outside of my school.
I completed a questionnaire to find out about my interests and abilities.
I researched the internet for information about careers.
I went to an organised tour in an <ISCED 3-7> institution.
I researched the internet for information about <ISCED 3-7> programmes.
I researched information on student financing (e.g. student loans or grants).

text.strong: ‌Which of the following qualifications do you think your <parents/guardians> expect or want you to complete?‌
‌In your opinion, which level of education do most of your schoolmates expect to complete?‌
‌What kind of job do you expect to have when you are about 30 years old?‌

text.em: ‌(Please type in the job title or describe the kind of work you expect to do in that job.)‌
